newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Aengus Finucane steps down as head of Concern.
newsitem.headline: Aengus Finucane steps down as head of Concern.

text.p: Father Aengus Finucane will step down as Chief Executive of the aid agency Concern at the end of April, the Chairperson of the agency, Tom Arnold, said on Thursday.
He said in a statement that Finucane, who has been Chief Executive since 1981, was retiring but would continue his association with the agency in a fundraising capacity.
"In his work with Concern over the past almost three decades, Fr. Aengus has shown a huge commitment to improving the life of the poorest people in developing countries.
"His capacity to express his great sense of practical humanity has been central to the very generous support which the Irish public has always shown Concern, Arnold said.
Finucane went to Africa as a Holy Ghost missionary in 1960 and was a founding member of the agency during the Biafra conflict in Nigeria in 1968.
